case_title: Mitha Khan, Ex-Sub-Inspector, District Jaffarabad vs Inspector-General of Police, Balochistan, Quetta and another

accussed_details.name: Mitha Khan
allegation: Misappropriation of arms and ammunition from Police Station City Sibi
Violation of Balochistan Police Disciplinary Rules, 1975

complaint_summary: The appellant was accused of misappropriation of arms and ammunition while serving as SHO Police Station City Sibi in 2013.
investigation_summary: Initial departmental disciplinary proceedings led to dismissal from service on 11.02.2014. Subsequent appeals resulted in reinstatement and de novo inquiry, which imposed forfeiture of six months' approved service. Later, additional charges were filed, culminating in dismissal on 22.03.2017.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found that the disciplinary proceedings violated principles of natural justice and Article 10(A) of the Constitution. The dismissal order dated 22.03.2017 was set aside, and the case was remanded for a de novo inquiry under applicable rules.
punishment: Dismissal from service (set aside by Tribunal)
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded for de novo inquiry
legal_arguments: Violation of Article 10(A) of the Constitution (right to fair trial)
Improper inquiry process under Balochistan Police Disciplinary Rules, 1975
Double jeopardy under Article 13 of the Constitution
statutes: Balochistan Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2011
sections: Section 4 of Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
Rule 6(1)(a) of Balochistan Police Disciplinary Rules, 1975

maxims.Audi alteram partem: No one should be condemned unheard

legal_terms.De novo inquiry: A fresh investigation or examination of a matter
legal_terms.Summary trial: A trial conducted without a full-fledged inquiry

words_and_phrases.Dismissal from service: Termination of employment as a penalty
words_and_phrases.Impugned order: The order being challenged in court

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around allegations of misconduct and procedural violations in disciplinary actions against Mitha Khan. The Tribunal emphasized adherence to rules and constitutional rights, remanding the matter for proper inquiry.
